Semiconductors: The tiny chips powering the global economy
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (2/5). As the fourth most traded product globally, electronic components have become essential to most industries. The sector, which is expected to reach nearly $1 trillion by 2026, has now become as powerful and strategic as the oil industry.

Algeria demands 'apologies' and 'reparations' from France for its colonial past
subhead: Algerian MPs passed a law on Wednesday, December 24, to 'criminalize French colonization,' amid ongoing diplomatic tensions between Algiers and Paris.

title: Zelensky unveils latest peace plan draft backed by US, setting conditions for demilitarized zone in the Donbas
subhead: The Ukrainian president opens the door to creating a demilitarized zone supervised by 'international forces' in the part of the Donbas controlled by Kyiv, making the withdrawal of Ukrainian troops conditional on the withdrawal of Russian forces.

title: Ukraine loses Siversk, a bastion guarding the last quarter of the Donetsk region
subhead: The Russian invading army has completed its occupation of the city of 10,000 inhabitants, which had held out for three and a half years. The eastern flank of the last conurbation in the Donbas that is still under Ukrainian control now seems exposed.

title: In New York, the invasion of drunken Santas
subhead: 'My Christmas under Trump' (3/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. In her latest dispatch, she dives into the Santa Claus convention, where every December 13, locals dress up in honor of the mythical bearded figure – a perfect pretext for a marathon bar crawl.

Disneyland Paris at 40: When Mickey Mouse said 'bonjour' to Paris
subhead: On December 18, 1985, the Walt Disney Company approved the construction of its first European theme park in Marne-la-Vallée, about 30 kilometers east of Paris. The prime minister secured the deal after tough negotiations between envoys from the Socialist government and an American corporation seen as the embodiment of ruthless capitalism.

title: Is Paris finally embracing musical theater?
subhead: Long considered unpopular by the French, musicals have flourished recently in the capital. But is this just a mere trend to which the French will inevitably turn their noses up?

title: 2025 was the year AI-generated videos flooded social media
subhead: The endless streams of millions of videos generated by artificial intelligence on Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, X, Facebook and beyond have become inescapable. And users want more.
